etymology.description: 笨 (clumsy; dull) + 手 (hand) = clumsy-handed; awkward with hands.
etymology.interpretation: Labels someone as lacking manual dexterity, especially in tasks like crafts, repairs, or cooking. Often contrasts with 巧手/灵巧 when talking about handiwork.

examples.chinese: 我做手工很笨手(我做手工很笨手)。
他修水龙头很笨手(他修水龍頭很笨手)。
别笑我(別笑我)，我对电器维修很笨手(我對電器維修很笨手)。
examples.pinyin: Bié xiào wǒ, wǒ duì diànqì wéixiū hěn bènshǒu.
examples.english: Don't laugh at me; I'm awkward with appliance repairs.
